titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bowyear, East India Company Resident at Bushere [Bushire], to Peter Elwin Wrench, East India Company Agent at Bussora [Basra]

mods.abstract: The letter discusses the prudence of staying out of local and regional politics as much as possible, illustrating the point with news that Shaik Nassir [Sheikh NƒÅsir] is unhappy with Benjamin Jervis' attempts to have him removed from power in Bushire. The trade in woollens is also discussed, specifically Karim Khan's desire to clothe his troops and the scarcity of Carmenia wool due to the upheaval of revolt there. The order for Mr Natter, on sick leave in Basra, to return to Bushire is given.
